abstract_summ: Patients 18 years of age and older undergoing intramedullary nail fixation of their femoral shaft fractures at a university-based level-1 trauma centre were assessed . Malnutrition was measured using serum markers (albumin <3.5 g/dL) as well as body mass index as a marker of obesity (BMI > 30 kg/m(2) Obesity may increase the risk of surgical site complications in orthopaedic trauma patients with high-energy injuries .
